Package com.hcyic1.brickdestroy.leaderboards

Class Score

java.lang.Object
com.hcyic1.brickdestroy.leaderboards.Score
public class Score extends Object
Represents an individual player's score.

  • Field Summary

  • Field Details

    • BASE_SCORE_MULTIPLIER

      public static final float BASE_SCORE_MULTIPLIER
      Each brick is worth this amount. Might consider setting different score multipliers for different bricks.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

  • Constructor Details

    • Score

      public Score()
      Empty constructor for score that initialises a zero-score object.

    • Score

      public Score(String name, int ballsUsed, int bricksDestroyed, float score)
      Constructor that generates a fully populated score. For use when testing or inputting a new user score.
      Parameters:
      name - user's name
      ballsUsed - number of balls used during the game
      bricksDestroyed - number of bricks destroyed during the game
      score - user's score at the end of the game

  • Method Details

    • incScore

      public void incScore()
      Reward the user by incrementing score for destroying bricks and keeping the ball bouncing.

    • resetScore

      public void resetScore()
      Reset the user's score to zero.

    • setScore

      public void setScore(float score)
      Set the user's score. Mostly for testing purposes.
      Parameters:
      score - new score

    • setName

      public void setName(String name)
      Sets the name of the user, used when receiving user input to save a new name.
      Parameters:
      name - the user's name

    • resetScoreMultiplier

      public void resetScoreMultiplier()
      To reset the multiplier to 1.0 after a ball has been missed.

    • updateCombo

      public void updateCombo()
      Increment the score multiplier following a logarithmic curve that is a function of bricks hit to reward the user for getting the first few combos, but prevent impossibly high scores down the line.

    • incBallsUsed

      public void incBallsUsed()
      To record a new ball being used after one has been missed.

    • setBallsUsed

      public void setBallsUsed(int ballsUsed)
      Sets the balls used for the user. Mostly for testing purposes.
      Parameters:
      ballsUsed - number of balls used

    • incBricksDestroyed

      public void incBricksDestroyed()
      Increments the bricks broken used by 1. Added for easier implementation of real-time high score updates.

    • setBricksDestroyed

      public void setBricksDestroyed(int bricksDestroyed)
      Sets the number of bricks destroyed by the user. Mostly for testing purposes.
      Parameters:
      bricksDestroyed - number of bricks destroyed by the user

    • getName

      public String getName()
      Returns:
      string of the username.

    • getBallsUsed

      public int getBallsUsed()
      Returns:
      int of number of balls used.

    • getBricksDestroyed

      public int getBricksDestroyed()
      Returns:
      int of number of bricks destroyed,

    • getScore

      public float getScore()
      Mostly used for sorting and displaying to the UI.
      Returns:
      float of the user's score.

    • getCombo

      public float getCombo()
      Mostly used to display to the UI.
      Returns:
      float of the user's current score multiplier.

    • scoreToString

      public String scoreToString()
      Converts the properties of Score into a string representation. Mostly for testing, debugging and file output.
      Returns:
      comma-delimited string

    • scoreToSeparatedStrings

      public String[] scoreToSeparatedStrings()
      Separates the score string by commas into columns. Mostly for generating tables.
      Returns:
      an 2D array of cells.

    • isBetterThan

      public boolean isBetterThan(Score score)
      Compares two Score objects by the score property which is a float. Useful for direct comparison.
      Parameters:
      score - the Score object to be compared.
      Returns:
      a boolean value.
